010package imagingbook.common.color.cie;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * Enumeration of selected standard illuminants.
017 * See Sec. 14.1.3 of [1] for details.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; 
021 * An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
022 * </p>
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 *
026 */
027public enum StandardIlluminant implements Illuminant {
028        /** Equal energy illuminant, neutral point (5400K). */
029        N       (1.0/3, 1.0/3),
030        /** D50 standard illuminant (5000K). */
031        D50     (0.9642, 1.0, 0.8249), // according to Specification ICC.1:2010 (Profile version 4.3.0.0)
032        /** D55 standard illuminant (5500K). */
033        D55 (0.33411, 0.34877), 
034        /** D65 standard illuminant used for television and sRGB color space (6500K). */
035        D65 (0.9505, 1.0, 1.0890),      // according to Specification ICC.1:2010 (Profile version 4.3.0.0), was  (0.950456, 1.0, 1.088754),
036        /** D75 standard illuminant (7500K). */
037        D75 (0.29968, 0.31740),
038        /** Incandescent tungsten (2856K). */
039        A       (0.45117, 0.40594),
040        /** Obsolete, direct sunlight at noon (4874K). */
041        B       (0.3498, 0.3527),
042        /** Obsolete, north sky daylight (6774K). */
043        C       (0.31039, 0.31905),
044        /** Cool White Fluorescent CWF (4200K). */
045        F2      (0.37928, 0.36723),
046        /** Broad-Band Daylight Fluorescent (6500K). */
047        F7      (0.31565, 0.32951),
048        /** Narrow Band White Fluorescent (4000K). */
049        F11     (0.38543, 0.37110);
050        
051        private final double X, Y, Z;
052        
053        private StandardIlluminant(double X, double Y, double Z) {
054                this.X = X; this.Y = Y; this.Z = Z;
055        }
056        
057        private StandardIlluminant(double x, double y) {
058                if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
059                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illuminant y cannot be zero");
060                }
061                this.Y = 1.0;
062                this.X = x * this.Y / y;
063                this.Z = (1.0 - x - y) * this.Y / y;
064        }
065        
066        @Override
067        public double[] getXYZ() {
068                return new double[] {X, Y, Z};
069        }
070        
071}
